John Worne the author of the article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't from The Telegraph on 27th January 2015, claims that language larning is vital for the UK's future prosperity and global standing (l. 16).
Now there comes up the question in how far?
To start you could say that our whole world is embossed by a big global change.
The globalization includes also the global standing from every country becausbecause language plays a big role in trading, working or education sector.
If UK students represent now a kind of laziness because they cannot communicate with people all over the world it creates a disliking picture on the whole UK.
In addition to that are languages significant for other sectors like global communication in general or for the main education.
Of course you can say that our iPhones could translate all those but it always taketakes more time to firstly type in a whole message or text than to just speak to each other.

So to conclude I would agree with John Worne's statement that foreign language learning is vital or very important due to the big usability in much sectors and especially for the global standing in our today's modernized increasing world of new chances and opportunities.
